questions.question: What property of the paramagnetic sample causes a change in mass in the Gouy balance?
How is the magnetic susceptibility calculated in the Gouy balance experiment?

answers.b: By calculating the force between two magnets
answers.c: Using the change in mass, field strength, and sample length
answers.d: By direct measurement with a multimeter

questions.question: Which force acts on the sample in the Gouy balance when exposed to a magnetic field?

answers.b: Magnetic force due to field gradient

questions.question: What happens to the mass reading when a paramagnetic sample is placed in the magnetic field?
Why is the Gouy balance method suitable for measuring magnetic susceptibility?

answers.b: It measures the magnetic response through the force acting on a sample
